JAMES O. EASTLAND. MISS., CHAIRMAN
JOHN L. MCCLELLAN. ARK. EVERETT MCKINLEY DIRKSEN, ILL*
SAM J. ERVIN. JR.. N.C. ROMAN L. HRUSKA, NEBR.
THOMAS J. DODD, CONN. HIRAM L. FONG, HAWAII
PHILIP A. HART, MICH. HUGH SCOTT. PA.
EDWARD V. LONG, MO. JACOB K. JAYITS, N.Y.
EDWARD M. KENNEDY. MASS.
QUENTIN N. BURDICK, N. DAK.
JOSEPH D. TYDINGS. MD.
GEORGE A. SMATHERS, FLA.
'SI Crotch Senate
COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY
April 10, 1967
Mr. William R. Boehle
Chairman, Department of Music
The University of North Dakota
Grand Forks, North Dakota 58201
Dear Mr. Boehle:
Thank you very much for your letter concerning S. 1160,
a bill which would authorize funds for educational
radio and television.
I am planning to appear before the Senate Commerce SubÂ¬
committee which is holding hearings on this bill to
express my support and to include in the hearing record
some of the benefits which this would provide to North
Dakota.
With kind regards, I am
Quentin N. Burdick
QNB:jmw
